title: Tennis Players Ask for Privacy at a Big Tournament
summary: Jessica Pegula and Iga Swiatek are tennis players who spoke out at the Australian Open, a big tennis tournament. They are worried about cameras filming them when they are not playing on the court. They feel like they are being watched all the time, just like animals in a zoo. They want more privacy so they can relax and focus without cameras around. Other players, like Coco Gauff, have also said this is a problem. The players think it is important to have private time away from the game. This is about respecting athletes and giving them space to be themselves off the court.

background_read: Tennis is a sport where players hit a ball over a net. Big tournaments like the Australian Open have many fans and media watching. Players often practice and rest off the court, and they need private time to feel comfortable and perform their best. Privacy means having space without others watching, which is important for everyone, including athletes.
